subject:
Re: [cc-community] Strayform - where artists and fans connecttofund
	and distribute new creative works
body:
On Sunday 20 May 2007 12:18 pm, Fred Benenson wrote:
> Here's an interesting one:
>
> http://thedailyswarm.com/swarm/interesting-idea-ebay-record-label/
>
> Basically, a musician is offering ONE copy of a particular track for sale
> on eBay. That track is licensed under BY-NC (I know I know) so the highest
> bidder has the right to redistribute the track non-commercially. 

I think I am missing something. Doesn't everyone get the right to redistribute 
the track non-commercially?

Ah, read the article. So you get to choose to sit on it or give it out 
non-commercially.

> In this 
> case non-commercial seems to forbid resale, one of the most common
> interpretations of the license provision, but also "commercial
> exploitations" which may or may not prohibit the highest bidder from
> posting it on an adwords blog.
>
> Anyway, I think its a particularly neat way to co-opt eBay and digital
> distribution to handle part of the job of a record company.

OK, mish mash time... What is to stop an artist putting a song up on ebay, 
with a reserve if desired, winner get's the honour of giving the track to the 
world on a BY-SA basis.

Or, as above but the winner gets rights to license the work out on a non-Sa 
basis as well. (A right shared by the author and each seperate from the 
other.) (I would expect this to go for more than the first example.
>
> Now we just have to wait and see how much the auction goes for (it starts
> on June 1st.)

I might try this idea out if I can find a way to get an ebay account.
>
>
> Fred

all the best,

drew
